beaches.name: Unawatuna Beach
beaches.description: A popular, crescent-shaped beach known for its calm waters, beach bars, and vibrant atmosphere. Close to Galle Fort.

beaches.name: Mirissa Beach
beaches.description: Famous for whale and dolphin watching tours. The beach is scenic with a relaxed vibe and is home to 'Coconut Tree Hill'.

beaches.name: Arugam Bay
beaches.description: Sri Lanka's premier surfing destination. It has a laid-back, hippie-surfer culture and is best visited during the East Coast season.

beaches.name: Hikkaduwa Beach
beaches.description: One of the original tourist hotspots, known for its coral reef sanctuary, lively atmosphere, and sea turtles.

beaches.name: Bentota Beach
beaches.description: A wide, golden sand beach that is excellent for family vacations and water sports due to its calmer waters.

beaches.name: Hiriketiya Beach
beaches.description: A small, horseshoe-shaped bay that has rapidly grown in popularity. Perfect for beginner surfers and a youthful, trendy crowd.

beaches.name: Nilaveli Beach
beaches.description: A quiet, pristine beach north of Trincomalee. Known for its wide stretches of white sand and access to Pigeon Island.

beaches.name: Tangalle Beach
beaches.description: A series of more secluded and untouched beaches. The currents can be strong, but certain bays are calmer.

beaches.name: Weligama Beach
beaches.description: The name means 'sandy village'. Great for learning to surf and famous for the iconic stilt fishermen.
